growing.water: Water regularly during dry periods to keep soil evenly moist

planting.whenToPlant: Early spring; can be succession planted every few weeks for continuous harvest
planting.propagation: Let flowers dry up and drop seeds naturally or manually collect seeds from dried flowers and scatter

careAndMaintenance.pruning: Thin if plants become overcrowded to ensure healthy growth
careAndMaintenance.general: Mulch to retain moisture and suppress weeds; remove flower heads if continuous leaf production is desired

harvestingAndUsage.whenToHarvest: When stalks are about 6-12 inches tall and pencil-thick
harvestingAndUsage.howToHarvest: Cut or pull entire plant from soil or snip leaves as needed; can regrow if roots are left intact
harvestingAndUsage.preservation: Can be stored fresh in the refrigerator or chopped and frozen for later use

ecologicalInfo.pollinators: Flowers may attract bees and other beneficial insects if allowed to bloom
ecologicalInfo.wildlifeResistance: Deters some pests due to its onion scent
